summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to attorney Brendan Quigley regarding trial preparation for a witness, Mr. David Rodgers, in a case scheduled to begin in November 2021. The email includes a trial subpoena attachment and requests scheduling for witness prep meetings.

persons.name: Brendan Quigley
persons.context: Recipient of the email from the AUSA; appears to be the attorney for the witness David Rodgers.

persons.name: David Rodgers
persons.context: Individual who is being called as a witness for a trial scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021; a trial subpoena is attached for him.

connections.description: Brendan Quigley is receiving correspondence regarding trial preparation for David Rodgers, indicating he is likely Rodgers' attorney.

events.title: Trial scheduled to begin
events.description: A trial is scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021, for which David Rodgers is being called as a witness.

events.title: Expected witness testimony
events.description: David Rodgers is expected to be called to testify closer to the end of the trial in December 2021.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: An Assistant United States Attorney is preparing to call David Rodgers as a witness for a trial beginning November 29, 2021.
The AUSA is pregnant and will be on leave in September and October 2021, necessitating early witness preparation.
A trial subpoena for David Rodgers is attached to the email.
The correspondence indicates active trial preparation in the Southern District of New York related to a case (likely connected to the Epstein matter given the document set).
The email is addressed to attorney Brendan Quigley, suggesting he represents the witness David Rodgers.
